criteria: Ability to differentiate between land and water on maps and globes.
Skill in locating general areas referenced in historical legends and stories.
Overall accuracy and attention to detail in map and globe interpretation.
descriptions: Student is unable to identify land or water on maps and globes.
Student can identify either land or water but not both on maps and globes.
Student can generally identify land and water but makes frequent errors or requires assistance.
Student can accurately identify land and water on most maps and globes with minimal errors.
Student can consistently and accurately identify land and water on various maps and globes.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of how land and water are represented on maps and globes, and can explain the symbols and conventions used.
Student cannot locate any areas referenced in historical legends and stories on a map or globe.
Student can locate only one or two areas with significant difficulty and inaccuracy.
Student can locate some areas with assistance, but accuracy is inconsistent.
Student can locate most areas with reasonable accuracy.
Student can accurately locate nearly all referenced areas without assistance.
Student can precisely locate and explain the significance of areas referenced in historical legends and stories, demonstrating an understanding of their historical context and geographical relevance.
Demonstrates no understanding of map or globe features
Displays minimal effort or accuracy in identifying locations.
Makes several inaccurate attempts to identify location
Locates most places with reasonable accuracy but requires prompting.
All locations can be correctly identified with few errors.
All locations are identified quickly and correctly, with an understanding of geographic features and locations.
